intro: Horkelia clevelandii var. brevibracteata, commonly known as the Cleveland's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. It has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, showy blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
